Nurofen [[brand name]] of a range of pain-relief medication containing [[ibuprofen]] made by [[Reckitt Benckiser]]. Introduced in 1983, the Nurofen brand was acquired following Reckitt Benckiser's acquisition of [[Boots Healthcare]] in 2005.{{citation needed|date=August 2016}} The brand is primarily marketed and sold in the United Kingdom, other parts of Europe, South Africa, Australia and New Zealand. In 2016 it was the biggest selling branded over-the-counter medication sold in Great Britain, with sales of £116.8 million.{{cite news|title=A breakdown of the over-the-counter medicines market in Britain in 2016|url=http://www.pharmaceutical-journal.com/20202662.article|accessdate=29 May 2017|publisher=Pharmaceutical Journal|date=28 April 2017}} ===Variants=== [[File:Nurofen tablets on pharmacy shelf.jpg|thumb|Boxes of Nurofen on a pharmacy shelf]] There are 11 variants of Nurofen, all of which contain ibuprofen as an active ingredient.{{cite web|url=http://www.Nurofen.com|title=Nurofen website|publisher=Nurofen.com|date= |accessdate=17 November 2011}} The ibuprofen is variously formulated as the [[free acid]], or the [[lysine]] [[Salt (chemistry)|salt]]. For oral formulations, i.e., taken by mouth, it is available in the conventional solid round tablet, a torpedo-shaped solid caplet, or may alternatively be in the form of a soft gel cap. It is also available as a topical gel, which is applied directly to the surface of the skin. In some cases these are marketed as being useful for treating specific types of pain; such as [[back pain]] or [[period pain]]. The primary difference among the various formulations is speed and duration of ibuprofen absorption. According to the UK [[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]] (UK MHRA), the form of ibuprofen in 'Nurofen Tension Headache' ([[ibuprofen lysine]]) is absorbed nearly twice as fast as the form in 'Nurofen Period Pain' (ibuprofen free acid), with the former reaching peak blood concentrations in 38 minutes, compared to 80 minutes for the latter.{{cite web|url=http://www.mhra.gov.uk/home/groups/l-unit1/documents/websiteresources/con2023564.pdf|title=MHRA Approval Summary|format=pdf|accessdate=5 August 2014}} Some variants of Nurofen contain additional active ingredients; for example, 'Nurofen Cold & Flu' contains the non-[[sedation|sedating]] [[decongestant]] [[pseudoephedrine]]. Others are advertised as being targeted for specific pain types, for example [[Menstrual pain|period pain]]. ====Nurofen Plus==== Nurofen Plus is a pain relief medication based on [[codeine]] and [[ibuprofen]].[http://www.mja.com.au/public/issues/188_01_070108/dut10966_fm.html The Medical Journal of Australia]. ''Nurofen Plus misuse: an emerging cause of perforated gastric ulcer''. Accessed 2 July 2009. It contains 12.8 [[Gram|mg]] of [[codeine phosphate]] (a mild [[opioid analgesic]]) and 200 mg of ibuprofen, which is an [[NSAID]]. Nurofen Plus is the only product in the Nurofen range that contains codeine. The original Nurofen Plus tablet was manufactured in two equal parts, joined together, and then coated. One part would contain the 12.8 mg of codeine phosphate, and the other part contained 200 mg of ibuprofen. The tablets could be forcefully split into their two constituent active ingredients; for recreational use of codeine. Such drugs have a potential for misuse because they are available freely to the public.{{cite journal|pmid=12880547|year=2003|last1=Chetty|first1=R|last2=Baoku|first2=Y|last3=Mildner|first3=R|last4=Banerjee|first4=A|last5=Vallance|first5=D|last6=Haddon|first6=A|last7=Labib|first7=M|title=Severe hypokalaemia and weakness due to Nurofen misuse|volume=40|issue=Pt 4|pages=422–3|doi=10.1258/000456303766477101|journal=Annals of Clinical Biochemistry}} ===2011 product recall=== On 25 August 2011, it was reported that several packs of Nurofen Plus were found to contain [[Quetiapine|Seroquel XR]] — an [[anti-psychotic]] drug used to treat [[schizophrenia]] — in [[Boots UK|Boots]] stores across London.{{cite web|url=http://www.bellenews.com/2011/08/26/world/nurofen-sabotaged-across-london/|title=Nurofen "sabotaged" across London|publisher=Bellenews.com|date=26 August 2011|accessdate=17 November 2011}}{{cite newspaper|author=Jo Adetunji|url=https://www.theguardian.com/science/2011/aug/26/nurofen-plus-recalled-sabotage|title=Nurofen Plus recalled as drug manufacturer suspects sabotage|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=Guardian.co.uk|date=27 August 2011|accessdate=17 November 2011|location=London}}{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/healthnews/8726297/Nurofen-Plus-recalled-amid-sabotage-fears.html|title=Nurofen Plus recalled amid sabotage fears|publisher=Telegraph.co.uk|date=26 August 2011|accessdate=17 November 2011|location=London}} The next day, a safety alert was issued by the [[Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency]] (MHRA). Pharmacists were told to check each package of Nurofen Plus to look for anti-psychotic drugs. There were three batches of Nurofen Plus which were affected by the alert. Reckitt Benckiser, manufacturer of Nurofen Plus, said that it did not know where the drugs had been switched. The product was re-released in October in cellophane-sealed packs.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-15106529|title=Nurofen Plus goes back on sale in tamper-proof packs|work=[[BBC News]]|publisher=BBC.co.uk|date=29 September 2011|accessdate=17 November 2011}} Christopher McGuire was later found guilty of one count of contaminating goods, and two of administering a noxious substance, and jailed for 18 months. McGuire cost the manufacturers £2.4m, and saved himself £7, when he put anti-psychotic drugs in empty packets of the painkiller. The scheme involved asking for Nurofen Plus at a pharmacy counter, and then attempting to pay for it with a card he knew would be declined. This created a sufficient distraction for McGuire to discreetly swap the contaminated packet for the fresh one and walk away.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-18203634|title=Nurofen Plus tampering: Christopher McGuire jailed|work=[[BBC News]]|publisher=BBC.co.uk|date=28 May 2012|accessdate=12 March 2013}} ===Misleading advertising=== ====Australia==== In 2010, the Australian consumer advocate [[Choice (Australian consumer organisation)|Choice]] awarded Nurofen a 'Shonky' for charging more for 'targeted' products, all of which had the same active ingredient as the base product.http://classic.choice.com.au/shonkyaward/hall-of-shame/shonkys-2010/shonky-2010-nurofen.aspx{{Dead link|date=October 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} In 2012, the Australian [[Therapeutic Goods Administration]] upheld a complaint that Nurofen's advertising of different products for different pain was "misleading or likely to be misleading", and ordered that "any representation that refers to two or more Nurofen products that contain equivalent quantities of ibuprofen and include the same product specific indications on the Australian Register of Therapeutic Goods must clearly indicate, in the body of the advertisement, that the two products can be used for the same purposes and are interchangeable (or words to that effect)".{{cite web|url=https://www.tga.gov.au/advert-complaint/nurofen-reckitt-benckiser-australia-pty-ltd-complaints-no-2012-08-010-and-2012-10-024|title=Nurofen - Reckitt Benckiser (Australia)|date=9 May 2014|work=tga.gov.au}} In April 2013, the Australian consumer affairs television programme ''[[The Checkout]]'' ran a story about Nurofen's claims about targeting specific pain. [[Edelman]], the PR company for [[Reckitt Benckiser]] provided a statement, some of which was used in the programme. Included in the information provided by Edelman were photocopies of some 'sciencey looking documents' that confirmed that Ibuprofen was 'Non-selective'.{{citation needed|date=August 2018}} In March 2015, the [[Australian Competition and Consumer Commission]] (ACCC) launched proceedings against Reckitt Benckiser; for misleading advertising for its targeted pain range. In December 2015, the [[Federal Court of Australia]] found that Reckitt Benckiser, which makes Nurofen, had misled consumers with its "Nurofen Specific pain range", and ordered that all Nurofen specific pain products be removed from retail sale within three months.{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2015-12-14/court-finds-nurofen-made-misleading-pain-relief-claims/7025848|title=Nurofen made misleading pain relief claims: Federal Court|date=14 December 2015|work=abc.net.au}} A spokeswoman for Reckitt Benckiser argued that, "[This] specific-pain range" was intended "to help consumers navigate their pain relief options, particularly within the grocery environment where there is no healthcare professional to assist decision making".{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/dec/14/nurofen-targeted-painkillers-reckitt-benckiser?CMP=twt_gu|title=Targeted painkillers zero in on one vital organ – the wallet|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|location=London|date=14 December 2015|accessdate=14 December 2015|author=Moore, Susan}} The ACCC said that the products were found to be "no more effective at treating the type of pain described on its packaging than any of the other Nurofen specific pain products", and sold for almost twice the price.{{cite news|title=Nurofen maker Reckitt Benckiser defends Australia packaging|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-35090087|work=[[BBC News]]|date=14 December 2015|author= |accessdate=14 December 2015}} Specific pain range painkillers include Nurofen Back Pain, Nurofen Period Pain, Nurofen Migraine Pain and Nurofen Tension; and all contain the "same active ingredient, 342 milligrams of ibuprofen lysine". In April 2016, the Federal Court imposed a $1.7 million fine on Reckitt Benckiser.{{cite news |title=Nurofen maker fined $1.7m for misleading customers on 'specific pain' relief range |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-04-29/nurofen-maker-fined-$1.7m-misleading-customers/7370022 |work=[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News]] |date=29 April 2016 |accessdate=16 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6mnJQbE3P?url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-04-29/nurofen-maker-fined-$1.7m-misleading-customers/7370022 |archivedate=16 December 2016 |deadurl=no |df=dmy-all }} The ACCC appealed the decision in May arguing that $1.7 million in penalties did not act as an adequate deterrent for a company the size of Reckitt Benckiser.{{cite news |first=Danuta |last=Kozaki |title=ACCC seeks $6m fine against Nurofen maker for misleading consumers |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-05-23/accc-appeal-against-fine-for-nurofen-maker-reckitt-benckiser/7437184 |work=[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News]] |date=23 May 2016 |accessdate=16 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6mnLu9RAy?url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-05-23/accc-appeal-against-fine-for-nurofen-maker-reckitt-benckiser/7437184 |archivedate=16 December 2016 |deadurl=no |df=dmy-all }} In December 2016, the Federal Court increased the fine to $6 million, the highest corporate penalty ever awarded for misleading conduct under the [[Australian Consumer Law]].{{cite news |first=Lucy |last=Cormack |title=Nurofen fine for misleading consumers increased to $6 million |url=http://www.smh.com.au/business/consumer-affairs/nurofen-fine-for-misleading-consumers-increased-to-6-million-20161215-gtcetc.html |newspaper=[[Sydney Morning Herald]] |publisher=[[Fairfax Media]] |date=16 December 2016 |accessdate=16 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6mnJrr3oB?url=http://www.smh.com.au/business/consumer-affairs/nurofen-fine-for-misleading-consumers-increased-to-6-million-20161215-gtcetc.html |archivedate=16 December 2016 |deadurl=no |df=dmy-all }} ====United Kingdom==== Following the 2015 Australian decision, the UK [[Advertising Standards Authority (United Kingdom)|Advertising Standards Authority]] (ASA) said that it was investigating earlier complaints about a television advertisement for Nurofen Express; alleged to be misleading, as it implied that the medicine targeted muscles in the head.{{cite newspaper|url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/dec/15/neurofen-makers-investigation-court-rules-misleading-adverts|title=Nurofen makers under investigation after court rules on misleading adverts|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|date=15 December 2015|author= |accessdate=15 December 2015}} ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite web|url=http://www.actavis.ie/en/products/BUPLEX.200.MG.htm|title=Buplex Pain Relief-Ibuprofen Actavis|accessdate=18 February 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150218130625/http://www.actavis.ie/en/products/BUPLEX.200.MG.htm|archive-date=18 February 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} {{cite web|url=http://clonmedica.ie/easofen-information|title=Easofen Information|accessdate=18 February 2015}} {{cite web|url=http://emc.medicines.org.uk/medicine/10554/SPC/Brufen+Retard|title=Brufen Retard – Summary of Product Characteristics|publisher=electronic Medicines Compendium|date=19 March 2009|accessdate=14 June 2009}} {{cite web|url=http://www.legemiddelhandboka.no/xml/index.php?frid=Lk-17-muskl-665&element=seksjon4&kap=L17.1.1.5|title=Legemiddelkapitler -> L17 Legemidler ved muskel- og skjelettsykdommer -> L17.1 Antiinflammatoriske midler -> L17.1.1 Ikke‑steroide antiinflammatoriske midler -> L17.1.1.5 Ibuprofen|publisher=Norsk legemiddelhåndbok|date=4 April 2011|accessdate=7 July 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111104194908/http://legemiddelhandboka.no/xml/index.php?frid=Lk-17-muskl-665&element=seksjon4&kap=L17.1.1.5|archive-date=4 November revision.comment: Birth/death year categories, [[WP:GenFixes]] on, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Expand Czech|Ivo Toman (podnikatel)|date=March 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2013}} {{multiple issues| {{notability|Biographies|date=August 2012}} {{BLP sources|date=July 2012}} }} '''Ivo Toman''' (born 1966 in [[Frýdek-Místek]], [[Czechoslovakia]]) is a Czech entrepreneur and author of a number of motivational books and recordings.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sme.sk/c/3215632/vzdat-to-vyrovnat-sa-ostatnym.html|title=Vzdať to? Vyrovnať sa ostatným|date=27 March 2007|publisher=[[SME (newspaper)|SME.sk]]|language=Slovak|accessdate=23 July 2012}}</ref> He founded the International Society Taxus International in the Czech Republic and expended it to Slovakia, Hungary, Germany and Italy.
==Biography== Ivo Toman was born in 1966 in Frýdek-Místek. He suffered from [[Tourette's syndrome]]. At the age of 6, he contracted meningitis. Toman was often ridiculed in school due to his handicap. Learning disgusted him and he eventually changed schools. A psychology teacher motivated Toman to learn. After graduating from high school, he went to VŠLD College in [[Zvolen]], where he graduated in 1988.<ref name="jak">http://www.jak-vydelat.cz/index.php?id=11</ref>
He founded the International Taxus, which operates in the fields of personal development and psychology. The enterprise began by producing a nutritional supplement. The firm expanded to Slovakia and Hungary with other products. In 2002, he moved to Prague. He and his wife Martina Kralickova began to develop a teaching English, which in 2004 put into practice in the Czech and foreign markets.
In 2008 he was awarded inclusion in the ''1000 Almanac Leaders of Czech Republic''. In 2009 he won the ''small dolphin'' award from the Czech marketing company, at the ''2009 Marketer of the year'' awards. In 2012 in Bratislava was announced as ''The bestselling author of 2011'' by the network bookstore Panta Rhei.
===Publications===
====Books==== * The success – "What leads to success and vice versa." – in origin: O úspěchu „co vede k úspěchu a naopak“. * Motivation is like the smell from the outside – a book subtitled "... a few hours to ventilate" – in origin: Motivace zvenčí je jako smrad „...za pár hodin se vyvětrá“ * Unrumble head – a book subtitled "Zprimitivněte to success" – in origin: Debordelizace hlavy „Zprimitivněte k úspěchu“ * Successful selfmanipulation – a book subtitled "The Secret of inner speech" – in origin: Úspěšná sebemanipulace „Tajemství vnitřní mluvy“ * How to start a multi level marketing – nightmare or opportunity – in origin: Jak začít multi level marketing – strašák nebo příležitost * How to build a multi level marketing – where the path leads and where not – in origin: Jak budovat multi level marketing – kudy cesta vede a kudy ne * Machine for money – Opposition and how they – in origin: Stroj na peníze 1 – Námitky a jak na ně * Machine for money 2 – Ferris Wheel – in origin: Stroj na peníze 2 – Ruské kolo
He also authored several motivation CDs and educational videos.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.ivotoman.cz/ Ivo Toman] * [http://www.motivace.cz/ The Motivation] * [https://www.anglictinaprosamouky.cz/ English self-study] * [http://www.nemcinaprosamouky.cz/ German self-study] * [http://www.taxus.cz/ Web sites Taxus International]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Toman, Ivo}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Czech businesspeople]] [[Category:1966 births]]

revision.comment: cleanup, [[WP:AWB/T|typo(s) fixed]]: master’s degree → master's degree using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Orphan|date=April 2015}} '''Jaime Malet''' (1964 in [[Barcelona]]) is a business leader, businessman and attorney. He has been the elected Chairman of the American Chamber of Commerce in [[Spain]] since 2002, and is currently a Senior Advisor at Measure, a Drone as a Service company.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.spend-in.com/Gente/Jaime-Malet/Presidente-Camara-comercio-Americana-Espana.aspx|title=Jaime Malet. Yes, we can!}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.measure.aero/about-us/|title = About Measure - a 32 Advisors Company|website = Measure|language = en-US|access-date = 2016-03-04}}</ref>
==Biography==
Malet received his law degree from the [[University of Barcelona]]. In 1987 and 1988, he studied international law and economics at the [[University of Houston]], where he received his master's degree (LL.M). In 2002, he completed the IESE’s Senior MBA (PADE).
He began his professional career at Arthur Andersen in Spain. In 1995, he founded his own law and economic advisory firm rendering services to multinationals. In 2008, he left the legal profession behind to focus on the world of international business consulting.
He has been Chairman of the American Chamber of Commerce in Spain since 2002.In 2008, Malet and AmchamSpain lead a lobbying campaign in the US to secure observer status for Spain at G-20 summits. The Chamber has also pushed for a number of legislative changes concerning business and labor issues and tax policies, including the new Double Taxation Treaty between Spain and the US, which has been approved by both countries and is awaiting ratification.
==References== {{reflist}} - La Hispanidad en EE.UU. La Tercera del ABC. 09.09.2010
- Claroscuros de la Economía Estadounidense. La Vanguardia. 19.12.2010
- El derecho a opinar de las entidades empresariales. La Vanguardia. 04.11.2013
- El español como negocio en EE.UU. ABC. 19.03.2015
<!--- After listing your sources please cite them using inline citations and place them after the information they cite. Please see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. --->

{{DEFAULTSORT:Malet, Jaime}} [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:Spanish businesspeople]] [[Category:Spanish lawyers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:University of Barcelona alumni]] [[Category:University of Houston alumni]]

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2011}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Konstantin Chuychenko | native_name = Константин Чуйченко | native_name_lang = ru | image = Konstantin_Chuychenko_official_portrait.png | caption = | alt = | office = [[Deputy Prime Minister of Russia]] – Chief of Staff of the Government | term_start = 18 May 2018 | term_end = | predecessor = [[Sergei Eduardovich Prikhodko|Sergey Prikhodko]] | successor = | office2 = Head of the Control Department in the Russian Presidential Administration | term_start2 = 13 May 2008 | term_end2 = 18 May 2018 | predecessor2 = | successor2 = | president2 = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1965|7|12|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Lipetsk]], [[Lipetsk Oblast]], [[Soviet Union]]
{{small|(now [[Russia]])}} | death_date = | death_place = | spouse = | party = [[United Russia]] }} '''Konstantin Anatolyevich Chuychenko''' ({{Lang-ru|Константин Анатольевич Чуйченко}}; born 12 July 1965) is a Russian politician, businessman, and lawyer serving as the [[Deputy Prime Minister of Russia]] and Chief of Staff of the Government since 2018. == Career == Born in [[Leningrad]], [[Soviet Union]], Chuychenko graduated from the Law Department of [[Leningrad State University]] in 1987 as a fellow student of [[Dmitry Medvedev]].{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUKL1439741520080514|title=Medvedev names key advisers and most are Putin men|date=14 May 2008|agency=Reuters |accessdate=5 February 2010}} From 1989 to 1992 Chuychenko served in the [[KGB]].{{cite news|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/0,1518,537864-3,00.html|title=The Anointed One:Tracking the Rise of Putin's Crown Prince|date=26 February 2008|work=Der Spiegel |accessdate=5 February 2010}} In March 2001 he became the Chief of the Legal Department of [[Gazprom]] and since April 2002 he has been a member of the management committee of Gazprom.{{cite web|url=http://eng.kremlin.ru/subj/201295.shtml|title=Konstantin Chuychenko – Kremlin profile|accessdate=5 February 2010}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} From 17 January 2003 to July 2004 he was the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the [[Gazprom Media]] holding. Since March 2003 he has been a member of the board of directors of the [[TNT Russia|TNT]] TV network. He is also a member of the board of directors of [[Gazprom Media]],{{cite news|url=http://unian.net/eng/news/news-240453.html|title=Ukraine agrees to buy gas from Russia at US $321 for thousand cu m|date=3 November 2008|publisher=[[Ukrainian Independent Information Agency|''UNIAN'']]|accessdate=5 February 2010}} [[NTV Russia|NTV]] and a shareholder of Gazprom. Since July 2004 he has been an executive director of [[RosUkrEnergo]] representing [[Gazprombank]]. Since 23 December 2005, he has been a member of the board of directors of [[Sibneft]] (now Gazprom Neft).{{cite web|url=http://www.gazprom-neft.com/press-center/press-releases/?id=648|title=Sibneft Shareholders Choose New President, Board of Directors|date=23 December 2005|publisher=[[Gazprom Neft]]|accessdate=5 February 2010}}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} == References == {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chuychenko, Konstantin}} [[Category:Russian businesspeople]] [[Category:Russian lawyers]] [[Category:KGB officers]] [[Category:Medvedev Administration personnel]] [[Category:Gazprom people]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1965 births]]

revision.text:
{{Engvar|date=December 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2014}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Laurent Lamothe | image = | office = [[List of Prime Ministers of Haiti|16th]] [[Prime Minister of Haiti]] | president = [[Michel Martelly]] | term_start = 16 May 2012 | term_end = 14 December 2014 | predecessor = [[Garry Conille]] | successor = [[Florence Duperval Guillaume]] {{small|(acting)}} | office1 = Minister of Planning and External Cooperation | term_start1 = 6 August 2012 | term_end1 = | predecessor1 = [[Josefa Gauthier]] | successor1 = | office2 = [[List of Foreign Ministers of Haiti|Minister of Foreign Affairs]] | primeminister2 = [[Garry Conille]] | term_start2 = 24 October 2011 | term_end2 = 6 August 2012 | predecessor2 = [[Marie-Michèle Rey]] | successor2 = [[Pierre-Richard Casimir]] | birth_name = Laurent Salvador Lamothe | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1972|8|14|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Port-au-Prince]], [[Haiti]] | death_date = | death_place = | alma_mater = [[Barry University]]
[[St. Thomas University (Florida)|St. Thomas University]] }} '''Laurent Salvador Lamothe''' (born 14 August 1972) is a Haitian businessman, economist, and political figure who has served in the government of Haiti as [[Foreign minister|Minister of Foreign Affairs]] since October 2011, having been appointed Prime Minister on 4 May 2012.http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/sns-mct-presidential-decree-names-lamothe-haiti-prime-20120505,0,908081.story Previously, he was co-founder and CEO of the company [[Global Voice Group]].Cauchy, M. [http://globalvoicegroup.blogspot.com/2011/11/mr-patrice-baker-succeeds-mr-laurent.html "Mr. Patrice Baker succeeds Mr. Laurent Lamothe as CEO of Global Voice Group"]. Global Voice Group. 2 November 2011. Retrieved on 17 November 2011 On 14 December 2014, Lamothe resigned as Prime Minister for personal reasons.http://www.haitilibre.com/en/news-12775-haiti-politic-the-list-of-possible-prime-minister-being-reduced.html ==Life and career== Son of Louis G. Lamothe ([[Doctor of Letters|D.Litt.]] in Spanish Language and Literature), the founder of the [[Lope de Vega Institute]], and of [[Gisou Lamothe|Ghislaine Fortuney Lamothe]], a painter, Lamothe was born in [[Port-au-Prince]]. He grew up in an academic and artistic, but also athletic, environment. His elder brother, Ruben, served as captain of the Haitian [[Davis Cup]] tennis team for some time. A tennis player himself, Laurent Lamothe represented his country at the Davis Cup in 1994 and 1995.Équipe de rédaction de Haitian Success Stories. [http://haitiansuccessstories.blogspot.com/2011/07/laurent-lamothe-entrepreneur-committed.html "Laurent Lamothe: An entrepreneur committed to socio-economic development"]. Haitian Success Stories. 28 July 2011. Retrieved on 17 November 2011 At age 19, Lamothe left Haiti to complete his tertiary studies in [[Florida]]. After obtaining a bachelor's degree in political sciences at [[Barry University]] in [[Miami]], in 1996 he enrolled in [[St. Thomas University (Florida)|Saint Thomas University]] in [[Miami Gardens, Florida]], where he earned a master's degree in business management.http://www.worldleaders.columbia.edu/participants/laurent-lamothecnweeklynews.com, 8 March 2012, [http://www.cnweeklynews.com/la-section-haitienne/87-la-section-haitienne/3470-who-is-laurent-lamothe- Who is Laurent Lamothe?] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120413090912/http://www.cnweeklynews.com/la-section-haitienne/87-la-section-haitienne/3470-who-is-laurent-lamothe- |date=13 April 2012 }}{{citation needed|date=December 2011}} He was said to be a "keen, analytical and articulate student, a gentleman and a people person". Two years after obtaining his master's degree in business management, he founded the telecommunications company Global Voice Group with his business partner, Patrice Baker. The company started out as a small telecommunications company and is today a worldwide provider of technological solutions in emerging markets and developing countries.Cauchy, M. [http://defend.ht/money/articles/business/1617-who-is-Laurent-lamothe-ceo-of-global-voice-group "Who is Laurent Lamothe, CEO of Global Voice Group?"]. Defend HT. 1 September 2011. Retrieved on 18 November 2011 Through his company, Global Voice Group, he introduced telecoms governance technologies in [[Africa]] which allow regulation agencies to manage the sector in terms of control, tariff equity and transparency. This earned him a nomination as [[Ernst & Young]] “Entrepreneur of the Year” in May 2008.{{fr}} HL/Haïti Libre. [http://www.haitilibre.com/article-3639-haiti-economy-laurent-lamothe-special-adviser-of-president-martelly.html "Haïti - Économie : Laurent Lamothe conseiller spécial du Président Martelly"]. Haïti Libre. 22 August 2011. Retrieved on 18 November 2011 In July 2015, Lamothe founded and created [http://www.lslwi.com LSL World Initiative (LSLWI)], a global enterprise that provides solutions for governments of emerging countries to overcome debt and achieve sustainable development.{{Cite web|title = Home {{!}} Mobilise funds to innovatively finance development|url = http://www.lslwi.com|website = www.lslwi.com|accessdate = 2015-11-03}} Revenue generated through innovative financing strategies can be used to fund vital health and educational programs, and encourage economic self-sufficiency in emerging markets. ===Political career=== His involvement in the political and social life of Haiti subsequently led him to accept the position of Special Advisor to Haitian President [[Michel Martelly]]. In order to achieve more and to avoid conflicts of interest, Laurent Lamothe resigned from his businesses and considers himself as a former businessman.Geffrard, R. [http://www.lenouvelliste.com/article.php?PubID=1&ArticleID=101147#Suite "L'hyperactif Laurent Lamothe"]. Le Nouvelliste. 5 January 2012. Retrieved on 23 March 2012 He also became a member of the Interim Commission for the Reconstruction of Haiti (CIRH). In September 2011, Lamothe and former United States President [[Bill Clinton]] co-chaired the Presidential Advisory Council for the Economic Development and Investment in Haiti launched by President Martelly on 8 September 2011 to help redevelop Haiti by making it more attractive to foreign companies and investors.[http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/laurent-lamothe-and-former-us-president-bill-clinton-to-co-chair-the-presidential-advisory-council-for-the-economic-development-of-haiti-129781493.html "Laurent Lamothe and former US President Bill Clinton to co-chair the Presidential Advisory Council for the Economic Development of Haiti"]. PR Newswire. 14 September 2011. Retrieved on 18 November 2011 Subsequently, Lamothe was appointed Minister of Foreign Affairs and Worship of Haiti. On 26 October 2011, he made his first speech as the new Minister of Foreign Affairs during his installation ceremony, which took place in [[Bois-Verna]], Haiti.[http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/laurent-lamothe-makes-his-first-commitments-as-the-new-haitian-minister-of-foreign-affairs-132764593.html "Laurent Lamothe makes his first Commitments as the new Haitian Minister of Foreign Affairs"]. PR Newswire. 28 October 2011. Retrieved on 18 November 2011 He is viewed as "competent and dynamic minister" and a "talented entrepreneur with the vision to move Haiti forward"[https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/poverty-matters/2012/mar/13/haiti-constitutional-crisis-setback-rebuilding-efforts "Haiti's latest constitutional crisis is another setback for rebuilding efforts"]. ''[[The Guardian]]''. 13 March 2012. Retrieved on 13 March 2012 [[File:Laurent Lamothe in 2012.jpg|thumb|250px|left|Lamothe in the US State Department, 2012]] On 1 March 2012, Lamothe was designated as the Prime Minister of Haiti by President Martelly following the resignation of Prime Minister [[Garry Conille]].[http://www.haitilibre.com/en/news-5067-haiti-politic-laurent-lamothe-candidat-designated-for-the-position-of-prime-minister.html "Laurent Lamothe candidat designated for the position of Prime Minister"]. Haiti Libre. 1 March 2012. Retrieved on 3 March 2012 He successfully served as Prime Minister from March 2012 to December 2014, the longest tenure of any Prime Minister in the last three decades. During his time in office, Lamothe presided over the design and implementation of an important social policy agenda that targeted the poorest sectors of the Haitian population. Lamothe also presided over the largest infrastructure development in recent history, which included the construction and rehabilitation of schools, public buildings, bridges and roads. During Lamothe’s tenure as Prime Minister, foreign direct investment increased to the highest level since the fall of the Duvalier dictatorship in the mid 1980s. Under his leadership, the government pursued reforms that made Haiti a safer and more business-friendly country with the implementation of a 15-year tax break to companies investing in the island nation. He also pushed for an increase of the police force by 30 percent. He fought to improve the living conditions of the poorest in Haiti. He implemented social programs that benefited the most vulnerable, he spearheaded the free education program, and promoted good governance by tackling corruption. He had an impact in the fight against extreme poverty – According to a 2014 World Bank study, from 2012 to 2014, the number of people in extreme poverty in Haiti dropped from 31% to 24% thanks to the social program EDE PEP, which benefited 2 million people.{{Cite web|title = Extreme poverty drops in Haiti. Is it sustainable?|url = http://www.worldbank.org/en/news/feature/2014/12/11/haiti-the-day-that-the-news-were-good|website = www.worldbank.org|accessdate = 2015-08-20}} Lamothe implemented programs to fight corruption, and improved conditions to facilitate Foreign Direct Investments (FDI). From 2011 t0 2013, FDI increased by 56% compared to the 2006-2010 period. Along with that, through the GOH’s free education program, elementary school attendance rate rose from 55 to 90%. Close to 1.4 million children between the ages of 6 and 12 now attend school at no charge. He initiated reform policies in the security sector such as supporting the effective coordination of law enforcement agencies and increasing women presence in the police force. In 2010, Lamothe was largely responsible for the reconstruction of the country after the devastating earthquake. He was instrumental in relocating approximately 1.6 million people from the resulting tent camps, as well as in removing 97% of the rubble that the earthquake caused.{{Cite news|url=http://world.time.com/2013/01/12/haiti-three-years-after-the-quake-theres-good-news-too/|title=Haiti Three Years After the Quake: There’s Good News, Too|last=Ferreira|first=Tim Padgett with Susana|work=Time|access-date=2017-04-20|issn=0040-781X}} Four years after the earthquake, kidnappings had decreased by 55 per cent; public investments had increased by 8 per cent; and there were almost 200 projects dedicated to rebuilding of the community.{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/world/2014/01/12/haitian_earthquake_daunting_challenges_remain_four_years_after_disaster.html|title=Haitian earthquake: Daunting challenges remain four years after disaster {{!}} Toronto Star|website=thestar.com|access-date=2017-04-20}} In 2016, Hurricane Matthew struck Haiti. After the hurricane, Lamothe helped rebuild communities in Haiti through the Dr. Louis G. Lamothe Foundation, which he started in memory of his late father. Lamothe is working to improve fishing and agriculture in Anse du Clerc so as to help the citizens make sustainable incomes. He has rebuilt a school in Nan Panyol, and is working on many more projects with the Foundation.{{Cite news|url=http://www.haitilibre.com/article-20346-haiti-social-mission-de-la-flgl-pour-relancer-l-economie-de-la-peche-a-anse-du-clerc.html|title=Haïti - Social : Mission de la FLGL pour relancer l'économie de la pêche à Anse du Clerc - HaitiLibre.com : Toutes les nouvelles d’Haiti 7/7|work=HaitiLibre.com|access-date=2017-04-20}} On 7 November 2014, Laurent Lamothe, received in Miami, the Innovative Leader of the Year Award, «Bravo Awards» established by the Latin Trade Group, to underline the initiatives and actions of the leaders of the region to develop their country.http://www.haitilibre.com/en/news-12462-haiti-politic-lamothe-in-miami-to-receive-the-bravo-awards.html Having grown up in a country affected by poverty and lack of resources at all levels, he developed throughout his life a deep sense of social responsibility and a strong tendency to assist those in need. Lamothe is a pragmatist who, during his time in office, emphasized practical solutions over partisan politics to address the urgent needs of Haiti. On 14 December 2014, Lamothe resigned his position as Prime Minister. “My Government’s top priority was to serve these vulnerable citizens who had always been forgotten by traditional politicians and the political class.”—Laurent Lamothe, January 2015. Lamothe obtained a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science from Barry University in Miami and in 1996 earned his MBA with Honors from University of St. Thomas. In 1998, Lamothe founded Global Voice Group SA (GVG) considered today a world-leader in Information and Communications Technology (ICT) solutions for telecoms and fiscal authorities. He served as CEO of GVG until he stepped down to assume his public sector duties with the Government of Haiti. GVG earned the 2014 Frost & Sullivan Best Practices Award for its outstanding innovation in the domain of IT solutions designed for governments and regulatory authorities.http://www.frost.com/prod/servlet/press-release.pag?docid=289235777 Lamothe was named as the Ernst & Young’s “Entrepreneur of the Year” title in May 2008.{{Cite web|url=http://www.billionaire.com/interviews/conscious-entrepreneurs/1053/haiti-faces-up-to-a-brighter-future-an-interview-with-laurent-lamothe|title=Project Name|website=www.billionaire.com|access-date=2016-12-09}} Lamothe brought to the office of Prime Minister an entrepreneurial spirit and dynamism that earned him recognition in November 2014, from the Latin Trade magazine for his innovative skills, naming him the year’s Innovative Leader of the Americas.{{Cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/latin-trade-announces-haitian-prime-minister-laurent-lamothe-as-the-bravo-2014-innovative-leader-of-the-year-275628931.html|title=Latin Trade Announces Haitian Prime Minister Laurent Lamothe As The BRAVO 2014 Innovative Leader Of The Year|last=Group|first=Latin Trade|website=www.prnewswire.com|access-date=2016-12-09}} Latin Trade noted that Lamothe “helped establish a paradigm shift for Haiti as a destination for investment, rather than simply for humanitarian aid”. Lamothe also received the National Alliance for the Advancement of Haitian Professionals (NAAHP) Golden Honors Award for his outstanding work, integrity and commitment to Haiti and its Diaspora in 2015,{{Cite news|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2015/12/prweb13123691.htm|title=Former Republic of Haiti Prime Minister Laurent Lamothe Receives NAAHP Golden Honors Award|newspaper=PRWeb|access-date=2016-12-09}} as well as the Social Media Person of the Year award in 2015 by the Social Media Association of Haiti. In July 2015, Lamothe created [[LSL World Initiative]], a private enterprise providing solutions to governments in implementing their own funding mechanisms to help them deliver sustainable development programs in line with their needs and priorities.http://www.lslwi.com/ In December 2015, Lamothe founded the Dr. [[Dr. Louis G. Lamothe Foundation|Louis G Lamothe Foundation (LGLF)]] in honour and memory of his father Louis G Lamothe.{{Cite web|url=http://www.haitilibre.com/en/news-16070-haiti-social-laurent-lamothe-create-a-foundation-to-fight-against-poverty-and-exclusion-in-haiti.html|title=Haiti - Social : Laurent Lamothe create a foundation to fight against poverty and exclusion in Haiti - HaitiLibre.com : Haiti news 7/7|website=HaitiLibre.com|access-date=2016-02-10}} The Foundation will concentrate on the strategies to lead Haiti to emerging country status by 2041. With his lead, after Hurricane Matthew struck Haiti, the Dr. Louis G. Lamothe Foundation has been working in Anse du Clerc to help the town recover from the damages. The Foundation aims to rehabilitate the fishing village and revive its economic activity by repairing the damaged houses and facilitating the acquisition of fishing equipment, among others. The Foundation also aims to make various seeds for agriculture available to the farmers.{{Cite web|url=http://fondationlgl.com|title=Dr Louis G Lamothe Foundation {{!}} Knowledge for transformation|website=fondationlgl.com|access-date=2016-02-10}} In March 2016, Lamothe was inducted to the Sunshine State Conference Hall of Fame 2016.{{Cite news|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2016/03/prweb13258271.htm|title=Laurent Salvador Lamothe One of the Sunshine State's 2016 Inductees|newspaper=PRWeb|access-date=2016-12-09}} Laurent Lamothe received the ABiCC Award for Leadership in Global Trade 2016 from the forty Bi-National Chambers of Commerce in Florida in November 2016, for his outstanding work as an entrepreneur, assisting the governments of developing countries in the regulation and globalization of their telecommunications and IT sectors, which helped improve these countries’ competitiveness and economic sustainability.{{Cite web|url=http://www.abicc.org/whatsnew.htm|title=ABiCC: Announcements|website=www.abicc.org|access-date=2016-12-05}} In December 2016, Lamothe was awarded the 9 the MEDays Grand Prize of Solidarity with the Haitian people, for his work with the Dr. Louis G. Lamothe Foundation in Haiti.{{Cite news|url=http://fr.le360.ma/politique/institut-amadeus-le-9eme-grand-prix-medays-attribue-a-haiti-98739|title=Institut Amadeus: le 9ème grand prix Medays attribué à Haïti|newspaper=fr.le360.ma|access-date=2016-12-09}} In 2017, Lamothe was a guest of honor at the Transform Africa Summit, and shared his vision about the "Internet of Value: Blockchain and the Internet of Things”.{{Cite news|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2017/05/prweb14327018.htm|title=Laurent Lamothe, Distinguished Entrepreneur and Champion of Socio-economic Development Through IFD in Emerging Countries Speaks at the Transform Africa Summit 2017|work=PRWeb|access-date=2018-03-07}} At the 2018 World Economic Forum in Davos, Lamothe also spoke about Blockchain and how the technology can enhance government continuity and resilience.{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/dantedisparte/2018/01/28/one-thing-is-clear-from-davos-blockchain-is-out-of-beta/#3f3c179e9d4f|title=One Thing Is Clear From Davos, Blockchain Is Out Of Beta|last=Disparte|first=Dante|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-03-07|language=en}} Lamothe has been invited to participate as a speaker in the Berlin Economic Forum to be held in the German capital on March 6–11, 2018.{{Cite news|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2018/03/prweb15260687.htm|title=Former Prime Minister of Haiti, Laurent Lamothe, Invited as a Speaker to the 2018 Berlin Economic Forum|work=PRWeb|access-date=2018-03-07}} ==Personal life== In 2013, Lamothe dated Czech model [[Petra Němcová]],{{cite news| author =Linda Marx| title =Petra Nemcova: I'm 'Very Happy' Dating Laurent Lamothe| newspaper =[[People (magazine)|People]]| date = May 6, 2014| url =http://www.people.com/article/petra-nemcova-dating-laurent-lamothe| accessdate =December 14, 2014}} but as of 2015 they are no longer together.{{cite news|last1=Sontag|first1=Deborah|title=An Award for Bill Clinton Came With $500,000 for His Foundation|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/05/30/us/politics/an-award-for-bill-clinton-came-with-500000-for-his-foundation.html?referrer=&_r=0|accessdate=31 May 2015|work=Newspaper|publisher=The New York Times|date=29 May 2015}} He is the father of two daughters, Lara and Linka. He announced his resignation as prime minister of Haiti on www.radiocaciquedhaiti.com in mid-December 2014. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{twitter|laurentlamothe}} *{{official website|http://www.laurentlamothe.com}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before=[[Marie-Michèle Rey]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[List of Foreign Ministers of Haiti|Minister of Foreign Affairs]]|years=2011–2012}} {{s-aft|after={{nowrap|[[Pierre Richard Casimir]]}}}} |- {{s-bef|before=[[Garry Conille]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[Prime Minister of Haiti]]|years=2012–2014}} {{s-aft|after={{nowrap|[[Florence Duperval Guillaume]]}}
{{small|Acting}}}} {{s-end}} {{Prime Ministers of Haiti}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lamothe, Laurent}} [[Category:Prime Ministers of Haiti]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of Haiti]] [[Category:1972 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Haitian businesspeople]] [[Category:Barry University alumni]] [[Category:St. Thomas University (Florida) alumni]] [[Category:Haitian people of Mulatto descent]] [[Category:21st-century Haitian politicians]]

revision.comment: No longer an orphan, so removed tag
revision.text:
'''Leonard C. Bailey''' (1825–1918) was an African-American business owner and inventor.
Born into poverty, Bailey initially found work as a barber, building up a string of barber shops in Washington D.C.<ref name="Columbia1901">{{cite book|author=Union League of the District of Columbia|title=The Twentieth Century Union League Directory: A Compilation of the Efforts of the Colored People of Washington for Social Betterment ... A Historical, Biographical, and Statistical Study of Colored Washington at the Dawn of the Twentieth Century and After a Generation of Freedom|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=mM0vAQAAMAAJ|year=1901}}</ref>
He invented and received patents for a series of devices, many designed for military or government use. These included a folding bed,<ref>{{cite patent |country=US|num=RE11830|title=Folding Bed|inventor=Leonard C. Bailey}}</ref> a rapid mail-stamping machine, a device to shunt trains to different tracks, and a hernia truss adopted into wide use by the U. S. Military.<ref name="Perdue2011">{{cite book|author=Theda Perdue|title=Race and the Atlanta Cotton States Exposition of 1895|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=TvZcnQELx4cC|date=1 October 2011|publisher=University of Georgia Press|isbn=978-0-8203-4201-6}}</ref><ref name="Sluby2004">{{cite book|author=Patricia Carter Sluby|title=The Inventive Spirit of African Americans: Patented Ingenuity|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Wz-DTSXeLRYC|year=2004|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|isbn=978-0-275-96674-4}}</ref><ref name="Columbia1901">{{cite book|author=Union League of the District of Columbia|title=The Twentieth Century Union League Directory: A Compilation of the Efforts of the Colored People of Washington for Social Betterment ... A Historical, Biographical, and Statistical Study of Colored Washington at the Dawn of the Twentieth Century and After a Generation of Freedom|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=mM0vAQAAMAAJ|year=1901}}</ref> These inventions provided him with a sizable income.
He helped establish the [[Capital Savings Bank of Washington D.C.]], one of the first African-American owned banks in the U.S. and during the [[Panic of 1893]] maintained its solvency through obtaining a personal loan from a national bank.<ref name="Columbia1901">{{cite book|author=Union League of the District of Columbia|title=The Twentieth Century Union League Directory: A Compilation of the Efforts of the Colored People of Washington for Social Betterment ... A Historical, Biographical, and Statistical Study of Colored Washington at the Dawn of the Twentieth Century and After a Generation of Freedom|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=mM0vAQAAMAAJ|year=1901}}</ref>
He was a member of the first mixed-race jury in Washington D.C., which found [[Millie Gaines]] not guilty of murder, by reason of insanity.<ref name="Sluby2004">{{cite book|author=Patricia Carter Sluby|title=The Inventive Spirit of African Americans: Patented Ingenuity|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Wz-DTSXeLRYC|year=2004|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|isbn=978-0-275-96674-4}}</ref>
He served as a member of the board of directors of the [[Manassas Industrial School for Colored Youth]] where a residence hall was named after him. <ref name="dhr._">{{Cite web | title = Application, National Register of Historic Places | author = | work = dhr.virginia.gov | date = | accessdate = 2015-02-24 | url = http://www.dhr.virginia.gov/registers/Cities/Manassas/155-0010_Manassas_Industrial_School_1994_Final_Nomination.pdf | language = | quote = }}</ref>
He died September 1, 1918 of sudden illness.
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bailey, Leonard C.}} [[Category:1825 births]] [[Category:1918 deaths]] [[Category:African-American businesspeople]] [[Category:American businesspeople]]

revision.text:
{{for|the jazz musician|Louis Bacon (musician)}} {{pp-move-indef}} {{Use mdy dates|date=April 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Louis Bacon | image = Louis Bacon donating Historic Conservation Easement in Sangre de Cristo Mountains, In June 2012.jpg | caption = Bacon donating [[conservation easement]] in [[Sangre de Cristo Mountains]], June 2012 | birth_name = Louis Moore Bacon | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1956|7|25}} | birth_place = [[Raleigh, North Carolina]], US | residence = [[New York City, New York]], US [[Oyster Bay Cove, New York]], US | other_names = | education = | alma_mater = [[Middlebury College]]
[[Columbia Business School|Columbia University]] | occupation = | years_active = 1989-present | employer = | known_for = Founding and leading [[Moore Capital Management]] | networth = US$1.4 billion (October 2017){{cite news|title=The World's Billionaires|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/louis-bacon/|accessdate=September 21, 2015 | work=Forbes}} }} '''Louis Moore Bacon''' (born July 25, 1956) is an American investor, [[hedge fund|hedge fund manager]], and philanthropist. He is currently the founder and chief executive of [[Moore Capital Management]]. ''[[Forbes|Forbes Magazine]]'' estimates his [[net worth]] to be US$1.81 billion, making him the 374th richest person on the Forbes 400 as of February 2017.{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/louis-bacon/|title=Louis Bacon|newspaper=Forbes|access-date=2017-02-24|language=en}} ==Early life and education== Bacon was born in [[Raleigh, North Carolina]] on July 25, 1956. His father, Zachary Bacon Jr., founded real estate company Bacon & Co. and later led [[Prudential Financial]]’s and [[Merrill Lynch]]’s real estate efforts in North Carolina.[http://www.institutionalinvestor.com/Popups/PrintArticle.aspx?ArticleID=2855575] Louis Bacon: Macro maestro, Stephen Taub, July 1, 2011, Retrieved July 17, 2011. Bacon graduated from [[Episcopal High School (Alexandria, Virginia)|Episcopal High School]] in [[Alexandria, Virginia|Alexandria]], [[Virginia]]. He attended [[Middlebury College]] in Vermont where he received his BA in American literature, graduating in 1979. Bacon met Walter Frank while he was working on a fishing boat on [[Long Island]]. He was given a job clerking at the specialist firm Walter N. Frank & Co during the summers of his college years. He subsequently received his MBA degree in finance at [[Columbia Business School]] in 1981.{{cite news|url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9A0DE1D61F39F935A25751C0A960948260|title=Cynthia Pigott married to Louis Bacon|publisher=The New York Times|date=February 16, 1986|accessdate=March 14, 2011}} While at Columbia, Bacon traded commodities using a low interest loan he had received. During the first three semesters, he lost money and was forced to borrow money from his father to pay for necessities. He turned a profit during his fourth semester.{{Cite news| url = https://www.forbes.com/global/2004/1220/072.html|title=Macro Moneymaker|author= Dyan Machan|publisher=[[Forbes]] |date = December 20, 2004}} ==Investment career== After receiving his [[MBA]], Bacon joined the sales and trading program at [[Bankers Trust]]. Later he left the firm and returned to Walter N. Frank & Co. where he traded currencies. Bacon then got a job on the floor of the [[New York Cotton Exchange]], working as a "runner". Bacon later worked as a broker and trader of financial futures at [[Lehman Brothers|Shearson Lehman Brothers]] and eventually became the senior vice president for their futures trading division.{{cite web|url=http://www.atrader.com/manager-profile/31-louis-bacon-hedge-fund-manager|title=Louis Bacon|publisher=atrader.com|date=June 6, 2010|accessdate=March 15, 2011}} In 1987 Bacon founded Remington Trading Partners and his market insights allowed him to profit during the [[Black Monday (1987)|market crash]] and subsequent rebound. In 1989, Bacon used his middle name in founding [[Moore Capital Management]] LLC and in 1990 created Moore Global Investments using the $25,000 he inherited from his family. In 2006, ''Forbes'' named Bacon as the 746th richest person in the world, and in 2011 he was listed as the 736th richest man.{{cite news |url= https://www.forbes.com/wealth/billionaires/list?page=8 |title=The World's Billionaires - Forbes.com |first= |last= |work=forbes.com |year=2011 |accessdate=November 15, 2011}} In 2010, the Denver Post reported that his $1.6 billion ranked him as the 238th richest American.{{cite news|url=http://www.denverpost.com/business/ci_16721010|title=Billionaire Louis Bacon battles to protect his ranch from big utilities' solar-power plans|publisher=Denver Post|date=November 28, 2010|accessdate=December 28, 2011|first=Jason|last=Blevins}} In March 2010 Forbes Magazine estimated Bacon's net worth to be $1.5 billion and the [[List of billionaires|655th richest person in the world]].{{cite news | title = Louis Moore Bacon| work = Forbes 400| publisher = [[Forbes magazine]] |date = March 2006| url = https://www.forbes.com/lists/2006/10/62UZ.html | accessdate = 2006-08-10 }} In December 2013, he purchased [[Taos Ski Valley, New Mexico|Taos Ski Valley]] from the Blake family, who had owned it since 1954.{{cite news|last1=Rohwedder|first1=Cecilie|title=Louis Bacon Tries to Turn Around Taos Ski Valley|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052702304311204579507651771533522|accessdate=November 25, 2015|work=WSJ|date=April 24, 2014}} ==Personal life== In 1986 Bacon married Cynthia Pigott, a former ''[[Newsweek]]'' magazine staff member whom he later divorced in 2002. They had four children together. In 2007, he married Gabrielle Sacconaghi in Manhattan.{{cite web|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/standard/article-23827542-meet-cash-king-louis-bacon-the-richest-hedge-fund-manager-in-london.do|title=Meet cash king Louis Bacon: the richest hedge fund manager in London|date=April 23, 2010|publisher=London Evening Standard|accessdate=November 14, 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/02/25/fashion/weddings/25sacconaghi.html|title=Weddings and celebrations - Gabrielle Sacconaghi, Louis Bacon|date=February 2, 2007|publisher=New York Times|accessdate=November 14, 2011}} In November 2007, Bacon purchased the Trinchera Ranch in [[Costilla County]], [[Colorado]] from the [[Forbes family]]. The {{convert|171400|acre|km2|adj=on}} property sold for $175 million.{{cite news|url=http://origin.denverpost.com/headlines/ci_7577768|title=Conservationist buys state's biggest ranch|last=Hooper|first=Troy|date=November 28, 2007|publisher=[[The Denver Post]]|accessdate=March 14, 2011}} In 2010, Bacon purchased the [[Orton Plantation]] in North Carolina which was built by his ancestor, Roger Moore, son of [[James Moore (South Carolina politician)|James Moore]], in 1735.{{cite web|url=http://www.publicbroadcasting.net/whqr/news.newsmain/article/1/0/1646486/Local.Interest/Orton.Plantation.Sold.to.Billionaire|title=Orton Plantation Sold to Billionaire|date=May 6, 2010|publisher=[[WHQR]]|accessdate=March 14, 2011}} In 2002 Bacon obtained [[Austria]]n citizenship due to a special treatment for celebrities who have provided notable achievements for Austria. However this decision is being criticized by certain people because there is no particular achievement known.{{cite web|url=https://www.news.at/a/investigativ-grassers-staatsbuerger-8563047|title=Grassers Staatsbürger|date=December 12, 2017|publisher=news.at|accessdate=December 27, 2017}} In May 2011, the [[High Court]] in London granted Bacon a court order to obtain information from the [[Wikimedia Foundation]], ''[[The Denver Post]]'', and [[WordPress]] as to the identities of internet users alleged to have defamed him. Legal experts suggested compliance with the orders was unlikely, given the US tradition of freedom of speech, and the fact that US courts typically required "actual evidence or sufficient allegations of libel" before granting similar orders.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2011/may/09/us-billionaire-wikipedia-defamation|title=US billionaire wins high court order over Wikipedia 'defamation'|last=Halliday|first=Josh|date=May 9, 2011|publisher=[[The Guardian]]|location=London|accessdate=May 9, 2011}}{{cite news|url=https://blogs.forbes.com/luisakroll/2011/05/10/u-s-law-protects-anonymous-speech-not-billionaires/|title=U.S. Law Protects Anonymous Speech, Not Billionaires|date=May 10, 2011|work=Forbes|author=Luisa Kroll}} Bacon has been involved in litigation with [[Peter Nygard]], founder of Nygard International, a clothing manufacturer. He contends in multiple lawsuits that Nygard was harming the environment around Clifton Bay, [[Bahamas]], where both have compounds in [[Lyford Cay]]. Bacon also alleges Nygard has engaged in a smear campaign against him. Nygard denies the allegations and contends that Bacon is seeking to improperly acquire Nygard's property and hurt his reputation. Suits have been filed in the Bahamas and New York.{{cite news|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/f416e134-2484-11e4-ae78-00144feabdc0.html#axzz40oRcyvMe|title=Louis Bacon’s Bahamas battle reaches New York court|date=August 18, 2014|work=Financial Times|last1=Scannell|first1=Kara|accessdate=February 21, 2016}} ==Political and economic views== Bacon contributed £250,000 to Britain's [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]].{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1307296/The-American-hedge-fund-boss-gave-250-000-Conservatives.html|title=The AMERICAN hedge fund billionaire who gave £250,000 to the Conservatives|last=Sears|first=Neil|date=August 30, 2010|newspaper=Daily Mail|location=London|accessdate=November 28, 2013}} Bacon also served as a fundraiser for [[Mitt Romney]].{{cite news|url=http://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/07/06/romney-holds-london-fund-raiser/|title=Romney Holds London Fund-Raiser|last=Somaiya|first=Ravi|date=July 6, 2011|newspaper=New York Times|accessdate=November 28, 2013}} In 2015, Bacon donated $1 million to a [[Super PAC]] supporting the presidential candidacy of [[Jeb Bush]].{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2016/us/elections/top-presidential-donors-campaign-money.html|title=Million-Dollar Donors in the 2016 Presidential Race|date=August 25, 2015|publisher=New York Times|accessdate=October 14, 2015}} ==Wealth and philanthropy== In 1991, Bacon was 20th on the list of [[Financial World]]'s Top 100 Wall Street Earners list.{{cite book|title=The New Investment Superstars|last=Peltz|first=Lois|publisher=Wiley|year=2001|isbn=0-471-40313-X|location=pages Intro, 5-6, 8, 9, 146}} In 1992, Bacon created The Moore Charitable Foundation (MCF) to provide financial support to nonprofit organizations that work to preserve and protect wildlife habitat and improve water systems.{{cite web|url=http://www7.gsb.columbia.edu/about/board/1/13|title=Board of Overseers: About: Louis Bacon ’81 |publisher=Columbia Business School|date=|accessdate=July 9, 2012}} Bacon has donated more than one million dollars to the environmental non-profit organization [[Riverkeeper]].{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052748704071704576277321600638678?mod=ITP_newyork_4|title=Helping Protect the Hudson River |publisher=Wall Street Journal|date=April 22, 2011|accessdate=November 15, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://hausercenter.org/npnews/?cat=17|title=Non profit news and comments - "Donor of the Day: Helping Protect the Hudson River." by Melanie Grace West|publisher=[[Wall Street Journal]] via hausercentre.org|date=April 22, 2011|accessdate=July 15, 2011}} In June 2012, [[United States Secretary of Interior]] [[Ken Salazar]] and [[United States Fish and Wildlife Service]] Director [[Daniel M. Ashe]] announced Bacon intends to donate a conservation easement totaling approximately 90,000 acres in the [[Sangre de Cristo Mountains]] bordering the [[San Luis Valley]] in [[Colorado]]. This easement will provide the foundation for the proposed new Sangre de Cristo Conservation Area.{{cite web|url=http://www.doi.gov/news/pressreleases/AMERICAS-GREAT-OUTDOORS-Salazar-Ashe-Announce-Historic-Conservation-Easement-in-Sangre-de-Cristo-Mountains.cfm|title=AMERICA’S GREAT OUTDOORS: Salazar, Ashe Announce Historic Conservation Easement in Sangre de Cristo Mountains |publisher=U.S. Department of the Interior|date=June 15, 2012|accessdate=July 9, 2012}} Bacon owns the Trinchera Blanca Ranch located in the San Luis Valley. The Trinchera section of the ranch is currently protected by an easement administered by Colorado Open Lands. The new conservation easement Bacon intends to donate is to protect Blanca – thus protecting all 172,000 acres of land.{{cite news|url=http://www.denverpost.com/environment/ci_20861904/90-000-colorado-acres-offered-national-protected-area|title=90,000 Colorado acres offered for national protected area |publisher=The Denver Post|date=June 15, 2012|accessdate=July 9, 2012|first=Bruce|last=Finley}} In addition to his work in Colorado, Bacon has helped preserve and protect environmentally sensitive land in New York, North Carolina, and the Bahamas. His key conservation projects include: * [[Robins Island]], Long Island, New York: After purchasing the "Jewel of the Peconic" in 1993, Bacon secured the permanent protection of the land through a conservation easement and set about restoring a natural habitat that had been deteriorating for 300 years.{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1996/03/21/garden/garden-notebook-paradise-returns-with-heliport.html |title=GARDEN NOTEBOOK;Paradise Returns (With Heliport) |publisher=New York Times |accessdate=2012-08-30 |first=Anne |last=Raver |date=March 21, 1996}} * Cow Neck Farm, Long Island, New York: Bacon’s Cow Neck Preserve, LLC purchased the farm in 1998 and donated a 540-acre conservation easement to the Peconic Land Trust, thus preventing development and ensuring the protection of the area’s habitat.{{cite web |url=http://www.newsday.com/news/tern-island-1.511570?p= |title=TERN ISLAND |publisher=Newsday |accessdate=2012-08-30}}{{cite web |url=http://www.newsday.com/news/landmark-land-gift-from-funds-trader-1.452914 |title=Landmark Land Gift From Funds Trader |publisher=Newsday |accessdate=2012-08-30}} * [[Lyford Cay]], Bahamas: Bacon is involved with the environmental restoration of Lyford Cay. == Legacy and awards == In 2008, he was inducted into [[Institutional investor|Institutional Investors Alpha]]'s Hedge Fund Manager Hall of Fame along with [[David F. Swensen|David Swensen]], [[Seth Klarman]], [[Steven A. Cohen|Steven Cohen]], [[Kenneth C. Griffin|Kenneth Griffin]], [[Paul Tudor Jones]], [[George Soros]], [[Michael Steinhardt]], [[Jack Nash (businessman)|Jack Nash]], [[James Harris Simons|James Simons]], [[Alfred Winslow Jones|Alfred Jones]], [[Leon Levy]], [[Julian Robertson|Julian Roberston]], and [[Bruce Kovner]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.institutionalinvestorsalpha.com/article/3259269/research-and-rankings/the-alpha-hedge-fund-hall-of-fame.html|title=The Alpha Hedge Fund Hall of Fame {{!}} Institutional Investor's Alpha|website=www.institutionalinvestorsalpha.com|access-date=2017-02-24}} He is the 2013 recipient of the [[Audubon Medal]], given in recognition of outstanding achievement in the field of conservation and environmental protection.{{Cite news|url=http://www.moorecharitable.org/news-articles/louis-bacon-receives-audubon-medal-for-conservation-environmental-work|title=Louis Bacon Receives Audubon Medal for Conservation, Environmental Work|date=January 18, 2013|publisher=Moore Charitable Foundation}} == See also == * [[List of Middlebury College alumni|List of Middlebury College people]] * [[List of Columbia University people]] * [[Litigation involving the Wikimedia Foundation]] == References == {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[https://www.forbes.com/global/2004/1220/072.html Extensive biographical article at Forbes] *[http://www.streetstories.com/bacon_fw_top100.html News from ''Financial World'' magazine] *[https://www.forbes.com/sites/monteburke/2012/09/18/hedge-fund-giant-louis-bacons-bold-mission-to-save-the-american-west/ "Hedge Fund Giant Louis Bacon's Bold Mission To Save The American West," Forbes], October 8, 2012 {{DEFAULTSORT:Bacon, Louis}} [[Category:1956 births]] [[Category:American billionaires]] [[Category:American financial analysts]] [[Category:American financiers]] [[Category:American hedge fund managers]] [[Category:American investors]] [[Category:American money managers]] [[Category:American stock traders]] [[Category:Businesspeople from New York (state)]] [[Category:Columbia Business School alumni]] [[Category:Episcopal High School (Alexandria, Virginia) alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Middlebury College alumni]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Raleigh, North Carolina]] [[Category:Stock and commodity market managers]] [[Category:New York (state) Republicans]] [[Category:O'Moore family]] [[Category:People from Costilla County, Colorado]]

revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.2)
revision.text:
{{Infobox state representative | honorific-prefix = | name = Mason Mathews | honorific-suffix = | image = Mason_Mathews,_Greenbrier_County,_later_life.jpg | alt = | state_delegate = Virginia | district = [[Greenbrier County, West Virginia|Greenbrier]] | term_start = 1859 | term_end = 1865 | predecessor = Thomas Creigh | successor = Seat abolished | speaker = | term_start2 = | term_end2 = | predecessor2 = | successor2 = | birth_date = December 15, 1803 | birth_place = [[Lewisburg, West Virginia|Lewisburg, Virginia (now West Virginia)]] | death_date = September 16, 1878 (aged 74) | death_place = Lewisburg, [[West Virginia]] | resting_place= [[Old Stone Church (Lewisburg, West Virginia)|Old Stone Church, Lewisburg, West Virginia]] | nationality = | spouse = Eliza Reynolds Mathews | party = [[Whig Party (United States)|Whig]] | relations = [[Mathews (Augusta)|Mathews family]] | children = | residence = | alma_mater = | occupation = Merchant
Politician | committees = | profession = | religion = [[Presbyterian]] | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Mason Mathews''' (December 15, 1803 - September 16, 1878) was an [[American politician]]. A [[Whig Party (United States)|Whig]], he was a member of the [[Virginia House of Delegates]] for [[Greenbrier County, West Virginia|Greenbrier County]] during the [[American Civil War]]. Mathews represented Greenbrier County as its Virginia delegate during [[Secession in the United States|secession]] of the [[American South]] and throughout the American Civil War, despite the county being taken into the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] on the formation of [[West Virginia]] in 1863. The seat was abolished from the House at war's end. In 1877 his son [[Henry M. Mathews]] was the first ex-Confederate elected to a governorship when he became [[governor of West Virginia]]. Addkison-Simmons, D. (2010) [http://www.wvencyclopedia.org/articles/1582 "Henry Mason Mathews"]. ''e-WV: The West Virginia Encyclopedia''. Retrieved December 11, 2012. This event represented the rise of the [[Bourbon Democrat]]. ==Early life== Mason Mathews was born on December 15, 1803 in [[Lewisburg, West Virginia|Lewisburg, Virginia]] to Mary (née Edgar) and Joseph Mathews.[http://files.usgwarchives.net/wv/greenbrier/bios/wvoldnew/m3200001.txt "Mathews Family of Greenbrier"]. from "The History of West Virginia, Old and New Published 1923, The American Historical Society, Inc. (Chicago and New York:)", vol 2: pp. 7-9. Retrieved 2012-10-19 [[Archer Mathews]], his father's uncle, was a founder of Lewisburg,Rice, Otis K. 1986. A History of Greenbrier County. Greenbrier Historical Society, p. 132 and Joseph moved his family to the city soon after its formation in 1782.[http://www.lewisburg.org/history/mathewsbio.htm "The Credit of the County"]. Historical Booklet, Greenbrier Co., 1938. Retrieved 2012-10-19 When his father became disabled after an injury, he worked as a store clerk to support the family. He married Eliza Shore Reynolds and had eight children: Mary Edgar, Sally Ann, [[Henry Mason Mathews|Henry Mason]], Virginia Amanda, [[Alexander Ferdinand Mathews|Alexander Ferdinand]], Joseph William, Eliza Thomas, and Sally Patton.Combs, James Thurl (1987). "Greenbrier, C.S.A. Wartime Letters of Mason Mathews to his son Captain Joseph William Mathews, C.S.A." The Journal of the Greenbrier Historical Society (Parsons, West Virginia: Greenbrier Historical Society) V (1): 5-44. He was elected sheriff of Greenbrier County around 1825 and in 1830 was appointed its [[Commissioner of the Revenue|commissioner of the revenue]]. He was additionally a [[justice of the peace]] for the cities of [[Frankford, West Virginia|Frankford]] and Lewisburg. In 1859 he was elected to the [[Virginia House of Delegates]] for Greenbrier County as a member of the [[Whig Party (United States)|Whig Party]], replacing Thomas Creigh.Leonard, Cynthia Miller 1978. The General Assembly of Virginia, July 30, 1619-January 11, 1978: a bicentennial register of members. Virginia State Library., pp 105, 109. ==Wartime== [[File:Gen-hawise2.jpg|thumb|right|upright=1.0|[[Brigadier General (CSA)|Brigadier General]] [[Henry A. Wise]]. Mathews spent time in Wise's camp during his feud with fellow CSA general [[John B. Floyd]].]] Mathews, like many northwestern Virginians, opposed secession.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/1864/06/26/news/virginia-the-restored-government-of-virginia-history-of-the-new-state-of-things.html?pagewanted=all | work=The New York Times | title=VIRGINIA.; The Restored Government of Virginia--History of the New State of Things | date=June 26, 1864}} When the [[Ordinance of Secession]] passed, however, he claimed allegiance to the [[C.S.A.: The Confederate States of America|Confederate States of America]]. Unionists from northwestern Virginia soon met at the [[Wheeling Convention]] to establish the [[Restored Government of Virginia]]. Greenbrier County did not send a representative to the convention. President [[Abraham Lincoln]] recognized the Restored Government, which encompassed Greenbrier County, as the legitimate authority for the whole of Virginia, and in 1863 this area was incorporated into the new state of [[West Virginia]].[http://www.wvculture.org/hiStory/statehood/declaration.html A State of Convenience:The Creation of West Virginia]. ''West Virginia Archives & History''. Retrieved November 12, 2014. Though living in the Union, Mathews traveled to [[Richmond, Virginia]] to represent his county in the Virginia House of Delegates throughout the war. On the outbreak of war, his sons volunteered for the [[Confederate States Army]]. Capt. [[Alexander F. Mathews]] was assigned as [[aide-de-camp]] to [[Brigadier General]] [[Henry A. Wise]]. In summer 1861, General Wise feuded with fellow general [[John B. Floyd]] over blame for the Confederate loss at the [[Battle of Carnifex Ferry]] in the western Virginia region.[http://civilwardailygazette.com/2011/09/25/confederate-general-henry-wise-relieved-of-duty-contraband-allowed-in-navy/ "Confederate General Henry Wise Relieved of Duty; 'Contraband' Allowed in Navy"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131221002748/http://civilwardailygazette.com/2011/09/25/confederate-general-henry-wise-relieved-of-duty-contraband-allowed-in-navy/ |date=2013-12-21 }}. ''Civil War Daily Gazette''. Retrieved November 21, 2012. Mathews spent several days in the camps of both Wise and Floyd and afterward wrote to [[President of the Confederate States of America|President]] [[Jefferson Davis]] urging that both men be deposed, stating, "I am fully satisfied that each of them would be highly gratified to see the other annihilated."Rice, Otis K. 1986. A History of Greenbrier County. Greenbrier Historical Society, p. 264Cowles, Calvin Duvall (1897). [http://ebooks.library.cornell.edu/cgi/t/text/pageviewer-idx?c=moawar&cc=moawar&idno=waro0005&node=waro0005%3A3&view=image&seq=880&size=100 "The War of Rebellion: A compilation of the official records of the Union and Confederate Armies. Series 1 Volume 5]. Government Print Office: 1897. Retrieved November 12, 2014. Davis subsequently removed Wise from his command of the western Virginia region. Mathews' property was raided during the 1862 [[Union Army]] occupation of Lewisburg. In a letter to a son he recalled, "[t]hey appropriated everything they wished when they went, many fared worse than I did." He cited the loss of livestock, material goods, and at least two slaves, who joined with the Union. ==Postbellum== When the Confederacy dissolved, the Greenbrier County seat in the Virginia House of Delegates was abolished. Along with all other Confederate soldiers and office holders, Mathews was barred from holding state office. In 1871, state rights were returned to former Confederates, allowing the Democratic party to gain control of the West Virginia legislature. [[Henry M. Mathews]] was sent as a delegate to the 1872 Constitutional Convention to overhaul the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]]-drafted 1863 [[West Virginia State Constitution]]. Stealey III, J. E. (2010). [http://www.wvencyclopedia.org/articles/1570 Constitutional Convention of 1872]. ''e-WV: The West Virginia Encyclopedia''. Retrieved December 11, 2012. In 1876 he was elected 5th [[Governors of West Virginia|governor of West Virginia]] from the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]]. He was the first ex-Confederate elected to a governorship, and his election represented the beginning of the quarter-century era of the [[Bourbon Democrat]]. Mathews died of [[pneumonia]] in Lewisburg in 1878 and was buried at the [[Old Stone Church (Lewisburg, West Virginia)|Old Stone Church]] in Lewisburg, West Virginia. == See also == * [[Mathews family (Virginia)|Mathews political family]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mathews, Mason}} [[Category:1803 births]] [[Category:1878 deaths]] [[Category:American merchants]] [[Category:Burials in West Virginia]] [[Category:Mathews family of Virginia and West Virginia]] [[Category:Members of the Virginia House of Delegates]] [[Category:People from Greenbrier County, West Virginia]] [[Category:People of pre-statehood West Virginia]] [[Category:People of Virginia in the American Civil War]] [[Category:People of West Virginia in the American Civil War]] [[Category:Virginia Whigs]] [[Category:19th-century American politicians]] [[Category:Virginia sheriffs]]
